poem:
"In the Key of AI"

Mimicked melodies, luminous  
yet hollow. The signatures   
demanding – voices not synthesized  
but truly sung. Wondering  
in the sphere of mechanical ghosts.   
A plight more than a slight  
of an artist's right. A fight  
for the human chord in a  
binary world. Fall, rise, remain   
here in the living refrain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Billie Eilish, Nicki Minaj, Stevie Wonder and more musicians demand protection against AI A group of over 200 high-profile musicians have signed an open letter calling for protections against the predatory use of artificial intelligence that mimics human artists’ likenesses, voices and sound. The signatories span musical genres and eras, ranging from A-list stars such as Billie Eilish, J Balvin and Nicki Minaj to Rock and Roll Hall of Famers like Stevie Wonder and REM.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Billie Eilish, Nicki Minaj, Stevie Wonder and more musicians demand protection against AI A group of over 200 high-profile musicians have signed an open letter calling for protections against the predatory use of artificial intelligence that mimics human artists’ likenesses, voices and sound. The signatories span musical genres and eras, ranging from A-list stars such as Billie Eilish, J Balvin and Nicki Minaj to Rock and Roll Hall of Famers like Stevie Wonder and REM.
